Trump says Qatar leaders a 'big factor' in achieving 'incredible' Middle East peace
subhead: Qatar has played a key mediating role in indirect talks between Israel and Hamas since the outbreak of the war, and is among the guarantors of the fragile peace deal, along with Egypt, the United States and Turkey.

title: Japan is still in love with bears, despite increasingly frequent and deadly attacks
subhead: The rise in bear attacks has caused concern in a country deeply attached to the animal. Climate change and the declining rural population have driven bears to venture more often into residential areas.

title: The Fondation Cartier unveils its new landmark in central Paris
subhead: The Fondation Cartier for Contemporary Art has moved to Place du Palais-Royal in Paris. Like its previous location on Boulevard Raspail, the new building was designed by architect Jean Nouvel, conceived as an innovative, flexible space that can be configured in countless ways.

title: Heroes' Memorial in Kyiv carries the pain of all Ukraine
subhead: Spontaneously created after the Russian invasion, this self-managed memorial honoring fallen soldiers has become a central site for civilians and military personnel alike.

'The Louvre's stolen jewels, valuable only for their gemstones, are above all outdated and cumbersome'
subhead: Reactions to the Louvre heist ignore the complex equation museums face: offering generous public access while securing cumbersome objects better suited for a bank vault, explains Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: Brigitte Macron's never-ending fake news nightmare
subhead: For four years, the absurd rumor that the French first lady is a man has continually spread. The Macrons have taken legal action, both in France and in the US.

title: Three years after taking power in Italy, Meloni is dropping the mask
subhead: Appointed in October 2022, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has reassured Brussels and financial markets, notably by reducing the public deficit. But behind this conciliatory image lies a far-right leader who has drawn ever closer to Donald Trump, even going so far as to imitate him on the domestic stage.
